head.supplied: 13 December 1861 ¶ My dear Dr Mueller. ¶ ¶ The little water hen which you sent me this morning (and which I hope has safely reached you again) which flew on board the ship Clutha, is ¶ Porphyrio Mar...

div.p: Director’s letterbooks, MVS 2/1 2, p. 18, Melbourne Museum.

The little water hen which you sent me this morning (and which I hope has safely reached you again) which flew on board the ship Clutha, is Porphyrio Martinica a bird common in all the warmer parts of Central and South America and the West Indian Islands. It is easily kept in confinement on head rice, &c and a little chopped meat occasionally

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I enclose a form of account for the corals and sponges for which I must ask you to have the price entered if you would be so kind, as I could not fix it myself: they are neither rare nor very good, but we require examples from N. E. Australia such as Mr. Fitzalan's
